solution_line_template: Three puppies on sale cost ${sale_price_per_puppy} x {num_puppies_on_sale} = $<<{sale_price_per_puppy}*{num_puppies_on_sale}={cost_of_sale_puppies}>>{cost_of_sale_puppies}.
So, each of those two other puppies cost ${cost_of_other_puppies}/{num_other_puppies} = $<<{cost_of_other_puppies}/{num_other_puppies}={cost_per_other_puppy}>>{cost_per_other_puppy}.
